intro: Erophila curtipes, commonly known as the narrow-leaved erodium, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its slender, upright growth habit. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color, arranged in whorled clusters along the stems. Its leaves are narrow and opposite, often with a slightly hairy texture. Erophila curtipes thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grassland or rocky habitats.
